nodes.bodyText: Can we collapse these into one catch block?
Yes, just not the way I have my studio set up.  I'll fix it.
Why not null?
to distinguish the case where I've already searched the class path and not found anything from the one where I have not yet looked through everything.
Is this constructor being used anywhere?
In the static getInstanceWithSecret factory.
Can we just get from classpath directly? without first checking for it in test utils

I want to give testUtils some sense of priority, to avoid disrupting anything that's currently in use.  If you're currently consuming testUtils as source, and aren't overriding the behavior by calling the methods that use the secret directly, then it should work just like it used to.
And I can't find it in the class path anyway, without making build changes I'm not willing to make.

Does this actually reset the LabAuthenticationHelper instance? It seems like getInstance(String keyVaultSecret) only uses the secret provided if the instance is null, otherwise it simply returns the old instance back.
Good catch.  We must not be using it elsewhere in the tests, otherwise my attempt would not have worked.
removed
What is this logic for? OneAuth?
Yes.  I'm amazed it worked - let me try removing it, since it seems to be completely wrong.
These two lines can be collapsed into one
done
What is this method for?
Better?
